sub_title: Mechanical Design Engineer | Making chips smaller, faster & more energy-efficient @ASML
summary:
► Mechanical design engineer at ASML (NL), the world's largest supplier of photo-lithography systems for the semiconductor industry. We make incredibly complex machines that allow the likes of Intel, Samsung & TSMC to print smaller, faster and more energy-efficient chips with a few nanometers accuracy.
► More specifically I am working on the modules of the EUV light source that deliver high pressure liquid tin, to allows the creation of 50k tin droplets per second, each of which will be vaporized by a 30kW CO2 laser to obtain tin plasma which will emit the EUV light.
► I am personally driven by learning, complex problem solving, creative thinking, innovating, working on cutting-edge technologies, and designing more sustainably.
► I have x2 Master diplomas in Mechanical/Industrial engineering, from the ESTII (Technical University of Madrid, Spain) and the ESTIA (Bidart, France).
► I am also fluent in French, English, and Spanish.

education.field_of_study: Mechanical, Electronics, Computer Science & Project Management

awards.title: 1st Prize of The 24h of Innovation 2015
awards.description:
Winner of the edition 2015 of The 24h of Innovation, in ESTIA, for the design of a tool for KUKA robots which facilitates "Pick & Place" operations for composite materials.

This competition is based on creativity and innovation in 24 hours chrono. The teams are freely composed of a mix of any students coming from different schools and university in France and abroad as well as professionals, consultants, freelancers, employees and artists. They have 24 hours to work on the subject they chose, proposed by companies, laboratories and creators, and that are kept secret until the opening ceremony.

awards.title: 1st Prize of The 24h of Innovation 2014
awards.description: Winner of the edition 2014 of The 24h of Innovation, in ESTIA, for the project "Transformers" : the design of an adjustable and automated wheelchair for the association V-e-culture.

profile_positions.description: Working on the mechanical design of the high pressure liquid tin delivery system, that allows the creation of 50000 tin droplets per second, each of which will be shot twice by a 30kW CO2 laser in a vacuum chamber to create tin plasma that will in turn generate the EUV light that is needed by the NXE scanner to print chips within a few nanometers accuracy.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Design Engineer - High pressure liquid tin delivery system

profile_positions.description:
I coordinated the integration of 1M€+ worth of new modules into the latest EUV light source of ASML's Twinscan NXE:3400 lithography scanner. 

I made sure that all modules and their interfaces were properly tested, the machine functioned as intended, issues were solved by the projects, and prototype machines were upgraded. I had to:
- Create and maintain integration plan in close co-operation with project lead.
- Organize hardware upgrades, design qualifications, tests.
- Create and review test specifications, summarize and communicate test plans.
- Collect integration issues and make sure there is follow up by project teams.
- Trouble-shoot prototypes, participate in tests/upgrades (hands-on).
- On behalf of the project, maintain claims for test time needed on prototypes.
- Provide feedback on status of project issues.
profile_positions.title: HW Integration Engineer - Tin mitigation in vacuum vessel - Laser beam delivery system

profile_positions.description:
I've been selected by ASML to join HighTechXL's 'Corporate Talent Program', which allowed me to accompany and help a team of deep tech startup co-founders in the first 3 months of their venture building. It was the opportunity for me to sharpen my entrepreneurial skills as well as to attend the various workshops & lectures the accelerator was offering.

The venture we envisioned aimed at improving telemedicine for prenatal care by developing a smart portable pregnancy monitoring device based on the technology of electroactive polymer.

Although I was involved in the various activities of business building (small team of 4), I mainly focused on the competition analysis and the definition of our value proposition.

At the end of the program I presented some of my takeaways from the experience during the final "pitch event" of the accelerator, and in front of some senior managers at ASML.
profile_positions.title: Deep tech startup 'co-founder' - Electroactive polymers applied to prenatal care

profile_positions.description:
Pragma Industries has been developing and producing hydrogen fuel cell modules for more than 10 years, bringing light and robust power solutions to the market. The best example would be "Alpha", the first commercial electrically assisted bicycle powered by a hydrogen fuel cell instead of a battery.

For my part, my main mission was to design and manufacture a 200W portable generator prototype, powered by a fuel cell and integrated in a military suitcase. We were a team of 2 designers working on the mechanical side of this project. We managed to get a fully operational generator in 2 months (see pictures below).

I also worked on :
>> The mechanical design and manufacturing of the core system of a 500W portable hydrogen-powered generator, for maritime use.
>> The manufacturing of a portable hydrogen generator.
>> Hydrogen fuel cells activation and testing.
>> Tooling design.

Software used : Solidworks.
profile_positions.title: R&D/Mechanical Designer - Hydrogen fuel cell products

profile_positions.description:
Safran Helicopter Engines designs and repairs helicopter turbines. In particular, the Tarnos plant, where I worked, takes care of MRO and support activities. I did my internship in the Supply Chain department. Within the firm strategy of reducing delays and costs, my mission was to develop numerical visual indicators, for use in the repair lines and which aim to help managers and operators to have an effective insight of the engines currently in the reparation process.

>> I gathered the specific needs of each repair lines in terms of management indicators (different engines, different needs), by meeting with the lines managers.
>> I developed these indicators in accordance with the expressed needs.
>> I initialized the deployment process, by redacting the deployment procedure while testing it on a test server made available by the IT System Department.
>> I trained my tutor, by providing her with a set of tutorials and documents so that she can best ensure the operational maintenance of the project.

The solution took the form of a Web Application, hosted on a server and available on a set of client PCs. The application extracts data from Excel files, shapes it in order to have a user-friendly & effective interface, and displays it on screen.

Software used : Visual Studio.
Languages used : Visual Basic .NET, XAML, SQL.
profile_positions.title: SW Developer - Visual performance indicators for turbine repair lines

profile_positions.description:
Design of an adjustable and automated wheelchair for the association V-e-culture. After that the project won 1st prize of the 24h of Innovation contest in ESTIA in 2014 with a team of engineering students I was part of, V-e-culture partnered up with Dassault Aviation so that I could continue the development of the wheelchair with the help of their technical means.

Within the Equipment and Robotic department of the Dassault Aviation's Biarritz plant, I realized the complete specifications for the wheelchair, and suggested to the association a technical solution with 3D modelization.

Software used : CATIA V5R20.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Designer - Innovative wheelchair
